 | Angiolymphoid hyperplasia with eosinophilia DiseasesDB = 31380 ICD10 = L98.8

'Angiolymphoid hyperplasia with eosinophilia' (also known as: "Epithelioid hemangioma," "Histiocytoid hemangioma,"
"Inflammatory angiomatous nodule," "Intravenous atypical vascular
proliferation," "Papular angioplasia," "Inflammatory arteriovenous hemangioma,"
and "Pseudopyogenic granuloma") usually presents with pink to red-brown, dome-
shaped, dermal papules or nodules of the head or neck, especially about the ears
and on the scalp. James, William; Berger, Timothy; Elston,
Dirk (2005). Andrews' Diseases of the Skin: Clinical Dermatology. (10th ed.).
Saunders. ISBN 0-7216-2921-0.
